intro: Eriosema heterophyllum, commonly known as the woolly eriosema, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
